jsdoc: Table of error names, descriptions, and code names and values.

value.description: the value of the error type

codename.description: a string identifier for the error type

description.description: a typical message for an instance of the error type

HierarchyRequestError.description: The operation would yield an incorrect node tree.

WrongDocumentError.description: The object is in the wrong document.

NoModificationAllowedError.description: The object can not be modified.

NotFoundError.description: The object can not be found here.

InvalidStateError.description: The object is in an invalid state.

SyntaxError.description: The string did not match the expected pattern.

InvalidModificationError.description: The object can not be modified in this way.

NamespaceError.description: The operation is not allowed by Namespaces in XML.

URLMismatchError.description: The given URL does not match another URL.

InvalidNodeTypeError.description: The supplied node is incorrect or has an incorrect ancestor for this operation.

DataCloneError.description: The object can not be cloned.

EncodingError.description: The encoding operation (either encoded or decoding) failed.

UnknownError.description: The operation failed for an unknown transient reason (e.g. out of memory).

ConstraintError.description: A mutation operation in a transaction failed because a constraint was not satisfied.

TransactionInactiveError.description: A request was placed against a transaction which is currently not active, or which is finished.

ReadOnlyError.description: The mutating operation was attempted in a 'readonly' transaction.

VersionError.description: An attempt was made to open a database using a lower version than the existing version.

OperationError.description: The operation failed for an operation-specific reason.

NotAllowedError.description: The request is not allowed by the user agent or the platform in the current context, possibly because the user denied permission.
